TYPE_AND_ACTIVITIES.TYPE_OF_ACTIVITY_OTHER: Defense of Human Rights, Democracy and the Rule of Law

SHORT_CONTRACT_DESCRIPTION.P: This tendering procedure is an international call for tender. It aims at concluding a framework agreement, with a minimum of 2 suppliers and a maximum of 5 suppliers (“pre-selected suppliers”’), provided that there are sufficient candidates satisfying the exclusion and eligibility criteria, for the provision of Freeze drying services to the EDQM, in the manufacturing of Reference standards.
At this stage, the framework agreement does not specify in detail the object of subsequent contracts or the exact technical specifications and chemical substances to freeze dry.

The framework agreement provides the holders in response exclusively to consultations launched by the EDQM for the award of subsequent contracts within the scope of the framework agreement for the whole duration of the agreement.

When a need arises, the Contracting Authority will proceed with a subsequent competitive tendering between all the framework agreement operators. The consultation file will include detailed technical specifications and, where relevant, special conditions and special tender rules applicable to the subsequent contract concerned.

LEGAL_FORM.P: — The Contractor may be a single company or a consortium. When the contract has been awarded, the Contracting Authority shall impose the form of a joint-liability-only consortium.
— The Contracting Authority shall not allow bidders to submit their bids in the capacity of both individual bidders and members of one or more consortia.
— The Contracting Authority shall not allow bidders to submit their bids simultaneously in the capacity of members of several consortia.

ECONOMIC_OPERATORS_PERSONAL_SITUATION.P: Minimum 3 references (full details) for similar services over the last 3 years: e.g. supply of freeze drying services to the pharmaceutical industry, to the chemical reagent industry, or to businesses entities or organizations active in the fields of reference standards or diagnostics.

EAF_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Turnover of at least EUR 200 000 excl. VAT per year.

T_CAPACITY_INFORMATION.P: Capacity to provide the services described in the Technical specifications.
Production facilities with a minimum batch size capacity of 3 500 vials, located in one of the 47 member states of the Council of Europe.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: The consultation files shall be made available for download free of charge at this link:
http://extranet.edqm.eu/dropboxout/060J4W8dKlTe6pBGX6Rvv2s0CwRCNpJyz8uYNXLJRBV/2018-AO-08-Freeze%20Drying%20Services.zip

Companies that do not wish to download the consultation files may also receive them by e-mail or on a physical electronic medium (USB key) if they send a written request to the address of the Contracting Authority indicated in article 7 of the present tendering rules.

Candidates who have downloaded the consultation file documents are requested to send their contact details by e-mail to purchasing@edqm.eu to allow the Contracting Authority to inform them of any changes arising during the call for tenders.

Contracts, framework contracts and framework agreements awarded by the Council of Europe are governed by the Financial Regulations of the Organisation and by Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.

The organisation enjoys privileges and immunities provided for in the General Agreement on privileges and immunities of the Council of Europe, and its protocols, and the special agreement relating to the Seat of the Council of Europe.

In accordance with the measures in article 11(3) Rule Nº 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe, the Contracting Authority stipulates that all bids must be sent in sealed envelopes to the Secretary of the tenders board.
Candidates must send their bids in a sealed envelope (single envelope containing the candidate documents and the bid) marked: "2018-AO-08 – Do not open”.
The bids must be sent by registered letter with acknowledgement of receipt to the following address: Council of Europe.
Palais de l’Europe – Service du Courrier (BP7) For the attention of the Tenders Board.
"2018-AO-08-freeze drying services-Do not open".
Avenue de l’Europe.
F-67075 Strasbourg
Bids received after the deadline set forth in these tendering rules, as well as those received in a non-sealed envelope, shall not be considered.
The time-limit for submitting bids is 4.00 pm on 2.2.2018. Hand-delivered bids will not be accepted.
Candidates may be excluded if they:
I. have been convicted in a final judgment on one or more of the following grounds: involvement in a criminal organisation, corruption, fraud, money laundering;

II. are in a state of bankruptcy, liquidation, cessation of activities or judicial settlement or in a preventive scheme of arrangement with creditors or any other similar situation resulting from a procedure of the same nature, or are the subject of a procedure of the same nature;
III. have been the subject of a judgment constituting res judicata for an offence concerning their professional conduct or serious professional misconduct;

IV. have not fulfilled their obligations relating to the payment of social security contributions or taxes or other duties, pursuant to the legal provisions of the country in which they are established.

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: See Rule 1333 of 29.6.2011 on the procurement procedures of the Council of Europe.
